summary: This is an internal email from the Chief of the Criminal Division at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated August 18, 2019. It discusses the upcoming week's schedule, including the finalization of a nolle prosequi (dismissal) in the Epstein case following his death, the cancellation of a unit chiefs meeting, and the sender's vacation plans.

persons.name: Chief, Criminal Division United States Attorney's Office, SDNY
persons.context: The sender of the email, discussing office schedules, the Epstein case nolle prosequi, and vacation plans.

events.title: AUSA interviews scheduled
events.description: Assistant United States Attorney interviews are scheduled to take place.

events.title: Other's Last Day
events.description: An unspecified individual's last day at the office.

events.title: Epstein nolle prosequi ready
events.description: The nolle prosequi (notice of dismissal) for the Jeffrey Epstein case is expected to be ready, pending receipt of the death certificate.

events.title: Email sent regarding week's schedule
events.description: The Chief of the Criminal Division sends an email outlining the week's schedule, including the Epstein nolle and cancelled meeting.
personsInvolved: Chief, Criminal Division United States Attorney's Office, SDNY

keyFacts: The email confirms the U.S. Attorney's Office was preparing a nolle prosequi (dismissal) for the Jeffrey Epstein case following his death, pending receipt of the death certificate.
The document is dated August 18, 2019, shortly after Epstein's death on August 10, 2019, indicating immediate procedural steps were being taken.
It reveals internal office scheduling, including the cancellation of a unit chiefs meeting due to unavailability and a lack of urgent need.
The sender, the Chief of the Criminal Division for SDNY, indicates they will be on vacation but available for critical matters.
